verses.roman:
devādayo brahma-mukhyā
na viśantaṁ sva-dhāmani
avijñāta-gatiṁ kṛṣṇaṁ
dadṛśuś cāti-vismitāḥ

synonyms: deva-ādayaḥ—the demigods and others; brahma-mukhyāḥ—headed by Brahmā; na—not; viśantam—entering; sva-dhāmani—His own abode; avijñāta—unknown; gatim—His movements; kṛṣṇam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; dadṛśuḥ—they saw; ca—and; ati-vismitāḥ—very amazed.
translation: Most of the demigods and other higher beings led by Brahmā could not see Lord Kṛṣṇa as He was entering His own abode, since He did not reveal His movements. But some of them did catch sight of Him, and they were extremely amazed.
